intro: Saxifraga camposii var. almeriensis, commonly known as the Almería saxifrage, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Spain. It thrives in rocky and calcareous soils, often found in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are typically basal, rosette-forming, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
